summary: This is an email chain from December 1, 2019, discussing a New York Times article about a con man named Patrick Kessler who attempted to convince attorneys David Boies and Stanley Pottinger that he had video evidence of sexual abuse by figures associated with Jeffrey Epstein. The sender notes that journalist Julie Brown was skeptical of Kessler.

persons.name: Julie Brown
persons.context: Mentioned as having been spoken to about Patrick Kessler; the sender notes she was skeptical of him.

persons.name: Patrick Kessler
persons.context: Described in the forwarded article as attempting to convince David Boies and Stanley Pottinger he had video evidence of sexual abuse by figures associated with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: David Boies
persons.context: One of the attorneys Patrick Kessler allegedly tried to convince about having video evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein associates.

persons.name: Stanley Pottinger
persons.context: One of the attorneys Patrick Kessler allegedly tried to convince about having video evidence related to Jeffrey Epstein associates.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the case; the alleged video evidence discussed pertains to sexual abuse by figures associated with him.

connections.description: Kessler allegedly attempted to convince Boies that he had video evidence of sexual abuse by Epstein associates.
Kessler allegedly attempted to convince Pottinger that he had video evidence of sexual abuse by Epstein associates.
The email sender spoke to Julie Brown about Patrick Kessler, and she was reportedly skeptical of him.

events.title: New York Times article published
events.description: The New York Times publishes an article titled 'Jeffrey Epstein, Blackmail and a Lucrative `Hot List'' about Patrick Kessler's attempts to sell alleged video evidence.

keyFacts: The document is an email discussing a New York Times article from November 30, 2019.

The article details alleged con man Patrick Kessler's attempts to convince attorneys David Boies and Stanley Pottinger he possessed video evidence of sexual abuse by figures associated with Jeffrey Epstein.
Journalist Julie Brown (likely of the Miami Herald) was reportedly skeptical of Patrick Kessler when spoken to about him.
The email suggests ongoing media and legal interest in potential evidence related to the Epstein case in late 2019.
The correspondence involves personnel from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY).
